channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Roe v Wade: US Supreme Court leak suggests abortion law repeal
item.description: Law that guarantees right to abortion described as "egregiously wrong" in document leaked to Politico.

item.title: Israel outrage at Sergei Lavrov's claim that Hitler was part Jewish
item.description: The Russian foreign minister's claim that Hitler "had Jewish blood" is denounced as unforgiveable.

item.title: Alabama hunt for missing prison inmate and guard
item.description: Police now believe the guard helped organise the escape and have issued a warrant for her arrest.

item.title: Former US police officer charged with murder in death of 12-year-old
item.description: Authorities believe Thomas "TJ" Siderio was unarmed and posed no threat to officers when shot dead.

item.title: Met Gala 2022: Celebrities show off lavish outfits in New York
item.description: Hundreds of famous names strike a pose on the museum steps for the over-the-top costume parade.

item.title: Jacky Hunt-Broersma: The cancer survivor who ran 104 marathons in 104 days
item.description: Jacky Hunt-Broersma, who lost her leg to cancer, set an unofficial record for consecutive marathons.

item.title: Trader made error in 'flash crash', Citigroup says
item.description: The benchmark Stockholm OMX 30 share index fell by 8% at one point on Monday morning.

item.title: Gay US student's killer jailed after 33 years
item.description: A Sydney man murdered the Cambridge University graduate at a gay cruising ground in 1988.

item.title: Uefa announces further sanctions on Russian clubs and national teams amid Ukraine invasion
item.description: Russia is barred from competing in this summer's women's Euro 2022 while Russian clubs will also be banned from Uefa competitions next season.

item.title: Amazon will pay US staff travel expenses for abortions and other treatments
item.description: The firm will reimburse travel costs for various treatments in the US, including abortion.

item.title: EU accuses Apple of breaking competition law over contactless payments
item.description: The US tech giant denies it is restricting rivals' access to its mobile payments technology.

item.title: EU divided over how to step away from Russian energy
item.description: EU energy ministers met to discuss a possible ban on Russian oil, but members remain split.

item.title: Why Europe will have to face the true cost of being in debt to China
item.description: The Beijing investment offers that need to be weighed up by European countries.

item.title: What a breakfast murder in India says about attitudes to wife beating
item.description: More than 40% women and 38% men in India say it is ok for a man to beat his wife. Why do they think so?

item.title: How phantom forests are used for greenwashing
item.description: Governments that make forest restoration promises they don't keep are accused of greenwashing.

item.title: Ukraine war: The southern villages holding back the Russians
item.description: Ukraine's south has seen heavy fighting as Russia seeks to take key port areas around the Black Sea.

item.title: Why does water flow from a tree in Montenegro?
item.description: Each year in the Montenegran village of Dinosa, water can be seen gushing from the trunk of a mulberry tree.

item.title: Orange skies as Iraq hit by dust storm
item.description: Experts say the storms are increasing in frequency due to drought and declining rainfall.

item.title: Emotional reunions as New Zealand reopens to tourists
item.description: The country has reopened its borders to visitors after a pandemic lockout of more than two years.

item.title: Ukraine war: Evacuation of Mariupol civilians under way
item.description: The UN says an operation to evacuate civilians trapped in a steelworks in Mariupol is under way.
